articles.title: Satish Sharma reviews supply position, transportation mechanism of essential commodities
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Sept 10: Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Information Technology, Transport, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma, today convened a high-level review meeting to assess the supply position and transportation of essential commodities across Jammu and Kashmir. The meeting was attended by Managing Director, JKSRTC, Rakesh Sarangal; Transport Commissioner, Vishesh Paul Mahajan; and other senior officers of the concerned departments. During the meeting, the Minister was briefed about the daily deployment of trucks and the […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
SRINAGAR, Sept 10: Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs, Information Technology, Transport, Youth Services and Sports, Satish Sharma, today convened a high-level review meeting to assess the supply position and... [1594 chars]

articles.title: Union Textiles Secretary rolls out Modern Looms
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Sept 10: Union Textiles Secretary, Neelam Shami Rao, today reiterated the Government’s commitment to promoting and reviving the unique craft of hand-knotted carpet weaving. She made these remarks while distributing Modified Modern Steel Carpet Looms to artisans under the Integrated Wool Development Programme (IWDP) at the Indian Institute of Carpet Technology (IICT) campus, here. The event was attended by Commissioner Secretary, Industries & Commerce,. Vikramjit Singh; Joint Secretary, Ministry of Textiles, Padmini Singla; Director, Handicrafts & Handloom […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
SRINAGAR, Sept 10: Union Textiles Secretary, Neelam Shami Rao, today reiterated the Government’s commitment to promoting and reviving the unique craft of hand-knotted carpet weaving.
She made these remarks while distributing M... [3631 chars]

articles.title: Could your hot body charge your cellphone?
articles.description: GUEST RESEARCH:  Researchers at South Korea’s Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology claim to have developed technology that ena...
articles.content:
The technology, described as a ‘thermogalvanic cell’ is described as “a compact generator that converts temperature differences—such as the human body temperature (~36°C) versus surrounding air (20–25°C)—into electrical energy.”
USAN’s press release ... [2574 chars]

articles.title: Focus is on preserving sanctity of Tirumala & offering best services to devotees using technology: TTD EO
articles.description: TIRUMALA, Sep 10: The newly TTD Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal today said under the Instructions of Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu, the priority areas are to protect the sanctity of the temple, provide amenities to common devotees using technology. Spread Sri Venkateswara Bhakti across the country by building Sri Venkateswara Swamy temples in the capitals of other states and to further expand the services of Srivari Sevaks, he said. Utilizing the services of local Sevaks in the respective areas […]
